com.raweng.built

Class BuiltAnalytics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.BuiltAnalytics

  • public class BuiltAnalytics
extends java.lang.Object
    The BuiltAnalytics class provides an interface to built.io's analytics backend.
    Author:
    raw engineering, Inc

    • Method Detail

      • setApplication

        public void setApplication(java.lang.String apiKey,
                  java.lang.String appUid)
        Sets the api key and Application uid for BuiltAnalytics class instance.
        Scope is limited to this object only.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - Application api Key of your application on built.io.
        appUid - Application uid of your application on built.io.

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String key,
             java.lang.String value)
        To set headers for built.io rest calls.
        Scope is limited to this object only.
        Parameters:
        key - header name.
        value - header value against given header name.

      • removeHeader

        public void removeHeader(java.lang.String key)
        Remove a header for a given key from headers.
        Scope is limited to this object only.
        Parameters:
        key - header key.

      • superProperties

        public void superProperties(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> superProperties)
        Set Global Properties for all Events. Super properties, once registered automatically sent as properties for all event tracking calls.
        Parameters:
        superProperties -   HashMap object contains property name as key and its respective value as value.

      • setFlushInterval

        public void setFlushInterval(int interval)
        Set batch event execution interval time.
        Parameters:
        interval - flush interval time in second.

        Note:- Default batch execution interval is set to 1 minute.

      • cancelCall

        public void cancelCall()
        Request to cancel all analytics network calls.

      • trigger

        public void trigger(BuiltEvent builtEventInstance)
        Request to track an event.
        Parameters:
        builtEventInstance - BuiltEvent instance containing event info.
